Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries/Prelude/List/indexOf
Synopsis Index of first occurence of an element in a list.
Function int indexOf(list[&T] lst, &T elt)
Usage import List;
Description Return index of first occurrence of elt in lst, or -1 if elt is not found. Also see ambiguous: Rascal:List/lastIndexOf.
Examples 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>indexOf([3, 1, 4, 5], 4);
int: 2
rascal>indexOf([3, 1, 4, 5], 7);
int: -1
rascal>indexOf(["zebra", "elephant", "snake", "owl"], "snake");
int: 2
rascal>indexOf(["zebra", "elephant", "snake", "owl"], "eagle");
int: -1
